Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial to Determine the Maximum Effective Volume of 0.25% Ropivacaine for Superior Trunk Block in Shoulder Arthroscopy

Trial_Design.evidence: This prospective, randomised controlled trial was conducted at Changzheng Hospital.

Participants.evidence: Participants were adults aged 46-80 years, ASA I-III, scheduled for shoulder arthroscopy.

Intervention.evidence: The MEV90 of 0.25% ropivacaine for ultrasound-guided STB was estimated at 7.6 mL.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine the maximum effective volume (MEV90) of 0.25% ropivacaine to prevent HDP in 90% of patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was HDP occurrence, assessed 3 hours post-block.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: A biased coin design was used for volume assignment, with randomisation and allocation concealment achieved through sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was maintained for outcome assessors, patients, and clinicians.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Fifty-two patients were randomised and analysed.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Fifty-two patients were randomised and analysed.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The MEV90 of 0.25% ropivacaine for ultrasound-guided STB was estimated at 7.6 mL (95% CI: 6.5–8.5 mL) using isotonic regression.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Chinese Clinical Trial Registry (ChiCTR2200059042); first registered 23/04/2022.
